title.native: 東京喰種[トーキョーグール]√A

description:
The second season of Tokyo Ghoul.

The ghouls of Anteiku invaded the Aogiri's site in order to rescue Ken Kaneki who is being tortured. Due to provocation, he unleashed greater power enough to defeat Yamori. To become stronger, he decided to join Aogiri and left Anteiku. Ghoul investigators also making their moves by collecting information about the eye-patched ghoul - Ken Kaneki.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

node.description:
[Main Twitter](https://twitter.com/sotonami) | [Secondary Twitter](https://twitter.com/sotonamix) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCefY-So0u9tiqwCL1Xw3zvA/) | [Tumblr](https://sui-zakki.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/ishida_____sui/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/ishida_sui/) | [Tumblr](https://sui-zakki.tumblr.com/)

Sui Ishida, alternatively known as Sotonami, is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known for his dark fantasy series Tokyo Ghoul, a story about a young man named Ken Kaneki who gets transformed into a ghoul after encountering one. Additionally, he is the character designer and scenario writer for the Switch game Jack Jeanne.
The founder and representative of [Yamato Works](https://anilist.co/studio/7090/).

[Website](https://www.yutakayamada.com/)

Yutaka Yamada is a Los Angeles-based music composer known for his work on the anime television series "Tokyo Ghoul", "VINLAND SAGA" and major Japanese films such as "Death Note:Light Up the New World", "BLEACH" and "KINDGOM". His masterpiece soundtracks for "Tokyo Ghoul" have gained worldwide popularity with related videos totaling over 70 million views on Youtube.

In 2018, Yamada composed for "Cry Me a Sad River", a Chinese film which had succeeded with USD $51Mil. In the same year, Eminem sampled Yamada's master piece "Glassy Sky (from "Tokyo Ghoul")" on his song "Good Guy" in his "Kamikaze" album. 
In 2019, he has worked alongside Sony Pictures for their mega-hit live-action film "KINGDOM" in which he received nomination for the 43rd Japan Academy Film Prize for Best Music Score. WIT Studio, famous for producing "Attack on Titan", released their most anticipated animation series "VINLAND SAGA", with an original soundtrack composed entirely by Yamada. 

Born in 1989, Yamada graduated from Senzoku Gakuen College of Music where he passionately studied musical composition. In 2009, he entered and won the first prize at VIENNA INSTRUMENTS Strings Arrangement Contest.

Today, he is represented by Soundtrack Music Associates, and has since relocated his production base from Tokyo to Sonic Fuel Studios in Los Angeles.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/106669804) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/amazarashiofficial) | [Website](http://www.amazarashi.com)

A mysterious band led by singer [Hiromu Akita](https://anilist.co/staff/159938).

Österreich was the solo project of former the cabs guitarist Kunimitsu Takahashi.

The cabs broke up in February 2013 before going on a planned record release tour. Takahashi briefly disappeared before the band split, and later blamed the break up on his own "laziness" and mental difficulties at the time. The Band's dissolution ultimately became the catalyst that allowed for Takahashi to break out on his own.

In March 2015 österreich released a single "Munō", guest starring Ai Kamano of the alternative rock band haisuinonasa as a vocalist. The song was used as the opening theme of Tokyo Ghoul √A. In December 2018, österreich released it's second single  "Rakuen no Kimi" which was used as the ending theme for Tokyo Ghoul:re 2.
__Mike McFarland__ is an American voice actor, ADR Director, Script, and Line Producer at Funimation Entertainment.

[Website](https://www.donnaburke.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/db_singer_actor) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwl3O6yIEVSY49XwOS1QTpA)

Donna Burke is an Australian voice actress, singer, narrator and businesswoman.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/elliotleguizamo)

A Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Devon Daniels in _Power Rangers: Beast Morphers_.
He is the brother of [Denisse Leguizamo](https://anilist.co/staff/197588/Denisse-Leguizamo).

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/andrerinaldidub/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/andrerinaldidub) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/andrerinaldidub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@andrerinaldidub) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJB9-DmISWwZaBMmDqK7i2A) | [Site Web](https://www.andrerinaldi.com)

André Augusto Rinaldi is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director. He currently directs at Grupo Macias and at DuBrasil. He is the cousin of the voice actor [Fabricio Rinaldi](https://anilist.co/staff/209058/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2894227226) | [Tumblr](https://henrythurlow.tumblr.com/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HTAnimations) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/HenryThurlowAnimator)

Formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) between 2021 and 2024.

Graduated Pratt Institute with a Bachelor in Fine Arts in Animation in 2006.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2894227226) | [Tumblr](https://henrythurlow.tumblr.com/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HTAnimations) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/HenryThurlowAnimator)

Formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) between 2021 and 2024.

Graduated Pratt Institute with a Bachelor in Fine Arts in Animation in 2006.

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

[Website](http://themonicarial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rialisms) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rialisms/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaY5WvG6QScTq6dlRbCbp7Q)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer affiliated with Funimation and Seraphim Digital/Sentai Filmworks.

Monica's father is from Pontevedra, Galicia, Spain, and when she was young, her family would often visit there. She would translate for her younger brother some of the European Spanish-dubbed cartoons which included anime like Doraemon and Dragon Ball Z, often imitating the various characters. Monica studied ballet, tap, and jazz, but transitioned to musical theater when was 12. She studied acting through high school as well as college at the University of Houston. She's cited voice actor inspirations from The Simpsons, Family Guy, and Beavis and Butt-head. She was working on a theater show with Jason Douglas, who suggested she audition for ADV Films. Her first voice-over role was a walla in the 1999 dub of Martian Successor Nadesico.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
